comments.body: Sending multiple recipes to staged-recipes makes it hard to review and, once merged, there will be a race condition where a dependency, `cymem` for example, won't be available when this recipe is first built on the feedstock. So you will need to watch the builds and re-start them accordingly to the availability of the dependencies.

@ocefpaf I see. I don't mind watching for packages being built. Is that a hard rule? There is a related PR #2455 that also includes a bunch of dependencies. I estimate it takes a minimum 3-5 days to get a recipe merged and the feedstock created. So doing a separate PR for each small dependency would imply a longer wait time until we get the final package published.

> @ocefpaf I see. I don't mind watching for packages being built. Is that a hard rule?

Not a hard rule, that is why I merged it.

> There is a related PR #2455 that also includes a bunch of dependencies. I estimate it takes a minimum 3-5 days to get a recipe merged and the feedstock created.

Maybe b/c it is a bunch of recipes :smile: I rarely review many recipes. This batch you were in luck b/c I am waiting in line with nothing to do :wink: 

> So doing a separate PR for each small dependency would imply a longer wait time until we get the final package published.

I understand, but that is recommended.
